formalpara.title: Summary
formalpara.para: You must install Fedora 17 Server on a system to use it as a virtualization host in a ovirt-engine environment.

step.title: Download and Install Fedora 17 Server
step.para: Download and Install Fedora 17 Server on the target virtualization host, referring to the Fedora 17 Installation Guide for detailed instructions. Only the Base package group is required to use the virtualization host in a ovirt-engine environment.

important.para: If you are using directory services with no direct access to authentication files for user management, the vdsm package will fail to create the required system user when adding the host to ovirt-engine. To avoid this issue you must ensure that the authentication files required by the useradd command are locally accessible. Using a security policy with a mixture of local files and LDAP is recommended.

step.title: Configure VLANs
step.para: If you intend to use Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs) in your ovirt-engine environment, ensure that they are configured for access to the oVirt Engine.

formalpara.para: You have installed Fedora 17 Server. You must however complete additional configuration tasks before adding the virtualization host to your ovirt-engine environment.
